ALLEGATION:
On 7/4/22, two youth were in a room alone together and it is being alleged that they
engaged in sexual activity. Staff were completing chores when this occurred.
INVESTIGATION:
Interviews:
2

Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 6, 2022, in
collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Youth A reported on July 4, 2022, he had
sex with Youth B in his bedroom. He reported earlier that day, the staff took the
youth out to the beach where he saw women in bikinis, and this triggered him. Youth
A reported Youth B had asked to date him, and he agreed to be her boyfriend. Youth
A reported on July 4, 2022, after dinner he asked Staff 1 to go to his bedroom and
he did. He reported then Youth B came out her room and went into his room. Youth
A reported Youth B said she was going to come to his room and made up this plan.
He reported Youth B came into his room and they both got naked. He reported the
had sex as he explained he penetrated her with his penis and gave her oral sex.
Youth A reported a few minutes later he told Youth B to get out of his room because
he did not want to get in trouble. Youth A reported Youth B wanted to do sexual
things and never told him to stop. He reported they listened for staff and heard Staff
1 walk away and that was when Youth B came into his room. Youth A reported when
he heard Staff 3 he asked for the bathroom door to be open to distract Staff 3. He
also reported he told Staff 3 to go check on Youth B’s room so that Youth B could
sneak out of his room. Youth A was able to explain how staff are assigned youth
when they are at the start of their shift. He also reported the rule is if two youth are in
the bedroom and bathroom area that a staff needs to sit in the hallway. Youth A
reported staff did not do this on that day and that was how Youth B was able to get
into his room.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 6, 2022, in
collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Youth B reported she has only been living
at the facility since the end of June 2022. She reported she really likes this facility,
and the staff really care about her a lot. Youth B reported she feels comfortable and
can talk to staff about things when she needs to. Youth B was asked if she has ever
been touched inappropriately at the facility and she reported no. She reported she
gets along with all the youth and staff. Youth B reported on July 4, 2022, she went
into a male peer’s room because he kept asking her to go in there. Youth B reported
she did not know the male peers name and did not want to talk about the situation.
She reported she talked with her therapist about it and began to shut down talking
about the day. Youth B did report no one is dating at the facility and feels that staff
do a good job supervising the youth.
Staff 1/Complainant was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 6, 2022,
in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Staff 1 reported her role is to assist the
other direct care staff during the shift and make sure the shift runs smoothly. She
reported she was working on July 4, 2022, with Staff 2 and Staff 3. She was asked
about what staff were assigned to what youth that day for responsibility purposes.
Staff 1 reported she was assigned to Youth A and Youth C; Staff 2 was assigned to
Youth B and Staff 3 was assigned to Youth D and Youth E. She reported during
chore time, Youth A finished his chores quickly and then asked to go to his bedroom.
Staff 1 reported she let Youth A into the bedroom and then had to go focus on Youth
C because he was becoming aggressive. Staff 1 reported when she went into the
milieu Staff 2 was assisting Youth E with sweeping and Staff 3 was helping Youth D
3

take out the trash. She reported Youth B must have been in her room and because
of that there should have been a staff member sitting in the hallway monitoring the
two youth in the sleeping area. Staff 1 reported she did not communicate that she
had Youth A in his room because she was focused on Youth C was who was
escalated. Staff 1 reported about 10-15 minutes later, Staff 3 came from the
bedroom area and told Staff 1 and Staff 2 that he saw Youth B come out of Youth
A’s bedroom. Staff 1 reported she talked with Youth B, and she reported she was in
Youth A’s bedroom. Youth B reported Youth A encouraged her to go into the
bedroom and that they would not get in trouble. Youth B reported Youth A
encouraged her to take off her clothes and inappropriate touching occurred. Staff 1
reported Youth B began to blame herself and Staff 1 had to help calm her down.
Staff 1 was asked about Youth A’s safety plan, and she reported she was aware of
the plan. She reported Youth A should always have eyes on unless he is in his
bedroom then there needs to be variable internal checks completed not exceeding
15 minutes. Staff 1 reported staff are required to review all youth safety plans at the
start of every shift and sign off on them. Staff 1 reported she should have had
communicated better with the team and directed the staff to sit in the hallway when
she had to support Youth C when he was escalated.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 6, 2022, in
collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Staff 2 reported all the direct care staff on
the unit are collectively in charge of taking care of all the youth. She reported the
staff are supposed to communicate to one another when a youth is going to the
restroom or is going into their rooms. Staff 2 reported when a staff comes on to shift
that each staff member needs to review the active safety plans for the youth and
sign off on them stating they understood. She reported Youth A has a safety plan in
place to where he needs to be in eyesight at all times. Staff 2 reported she was not
in charge of Youth A when she worked on July 4, 2022, and was not sure who was
in charge. Staff 2 reported she believes she was assigned to work with Youth B and
Youth E this shift. She reported she believes she was assigned to those two
because she was helping Youth E with his chores. Staff 2 reported staff were
working with the youth on completing chores. She reported Youth B was in charge of
cleaning the doorknobs which she helped her with and then Youth B wanted to make
a phone call. Staff 2 reported she went into the staff office to get the phone and
phone book but when she came out of the office Youth B was no longer waiting for
the phone. Staff 2 went to assist Youth E with his chore of sweeping. At the end of
chore time, Staff 3 reported to her that he just saw Youth B come out of Youth A’s
bedroom and Youth A was in the bathroom. Staff 2 reported she went to talk to
Youth A about what happened. She stated Youth A was in his bedroom and was
crying in the corner. Staff 2 asked Youth A what was wrong and he reported that he
was in his room with Youth B and they got naked in his room. Staff 2 reported Youth
A disclosed he and Youth B performed oral sex on one another. Staff 2 reported she
does not know how Youth B got into Youth A’s room or how Youth A’s bedroom door
was open. She reported Staff 3 disclosed Youth B had told him she wanted to go
into her room to lay down so he let Youth B into her room and then let Youth A into
the bathroom. Staff 2 reported Staff 3 never communicated with her or Staff 1 about
4

allowing Youth A and Youth B into these rooms. Staff 2 reported Staff 3 was actually
working with Youth D. Staff 2 reported if Youth B was in her bedroom and staff let
Youth A in the bathroom a staff member should have stayed in the hallway to
supervise so that the youth did not come out of the rooms and have inappropriate
actions. Staff 2 reported the staff should have had better communication about the
whereabouts of each of the youth and who was supervising what youth.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 6, 2022, in
collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Staff 3 reported when a staff member
comes onto shift, they are assigned specific youth to supervise. He reported when a
staff is assigned a youth that youth is their responsibility for the shift. Staff 3 reported
the staff schedule is set up to show which staff is assigned to which youth. Staff 3
reported the ratio on the unit is two youth per every one staff member. He reported
on the B side unit there are five youth, none of them are one to one staffing, so they
had three staff working on July 4, 2022. Staff 3 reported he was assigned to Youth D
and Youth E that day. He reported during that day he was helping Youth D collect
the trash throughout the unit. When Staff 3 was walking around the unit Youth B
asked Staff 3 to open her bedroom door because she wanted to go to sleep. He
reported typically staff are supposed to communicate if they are letting a youth in a
bathroom or bedroom but since Youth B was loud about asking for Staff 3 to open
her bedroom door, he assumed everyone on the unit was aware. After Youth B was
let into her bedroom, Staff 3 and Youth D took the trash out of the building. When
Staff 3 walked back into the building near the bedroom area, Youth A asked Staff 3
to open up his bathroom and Staff 3 did. He reported since both Youth B and Youth
A were on bedroom side of the unit Staff 3 planned to sit in the hallway for
supervision. Youth A came out of his bathroom and Staff 3 allowed him into his
bedroom. Staff 3 reported within in a minute, Youth A peaked out his head from his
bedroom and asked Staff 3 if there was anyone else in the hallway. Staff 3 reported
to Youth A that Youth B was in her bedroom. Youth A then told Staff 3 to check
because he did not believe that was true. Staff 3 went to go check the bedroom and
saw Youth B walking out of the area around Youth A’s bedroom. Staff 3 reported he
told Staff 1 and Staff 2 what occurred. Staff 3 reported he did not know how long
Youth B was in Youth A’s room or how she got into Youth A’s room. Staff 3 reported
before he went to take out the trash and allowed Youth B into her bedroom, he did
not know that Youth A was in his bedroom already. Staff 3 reported if that was
known then a staff should have been sitting in the hallway monitoring the youth. Staff
3 reported Youth A was assigned to Staff 1, and she was in the milieu with Youth C.
Staff 3 was asked if they are aware of Youth A’s safety plan, and he reported that he
believed Youth A has one but could not remember exactly what was on it. Staff 3
reported staff are to review all the youth’s safety plans when they are on shift and
sign off. He reported he started his shift around 1pm that day but did not review the
safety plan until about 5 or 6pm. Staff 3 reported he did not know that he was
supposed to review the safety plans at the start of shift. When asked what could
have avoided the situation of Youth B being in Youth A’s bedroom alone, Staff 3
reported staff need to have better communication with where the youth are at.
5

Therapist 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 6, 2022, in
collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Therapist 1 reported she is the therapist
for Youth A. She reported she has been working with him on healthy coping skills
and healthy boundaries. Therapist 1 reported she has helped develop Youth A’s
safety plan with the team and feels that if it is followed correctly everyone will be
kept safe. Therapist 1 reported Youth A has told her about the incident that occurred
on July 4, 2022, about Youth B coming into his room and the sexual acts that
occurred. Therapist 1 reported she has increased her therapy sessions with Youth A
due to this incident. It was reported that due to Youth A’s history one to one
supervision funding is being requested and since he was moved to a different unit,
one to one supervision is being provided.
Therapist 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 6, 2022, in
collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Therapist 2 reported she is the assigned
therapist for Youth B and has been working with her for the past couple of days.
Therapist 2 reported Youth B disclosed the incident that occurred on July 4, 2022.
Youth B reported Youth A kept asking her to go into his room and he propped his
door open for her to come in. Youth B reported she has a hard time saying no and
did not want anyone to get in trouble. Youth B reported Youth A took off her clothes
in his room and that “bad touches” occurred. Therapist 2 reported she has been
meeting with Youth B on a daily basis and working on self-esteem and boundaries.
Therapist 2 reported she is finishing up a safety plan for Youth B which will make
sure when Youth B is in the milieu she is always in line of sight with staff.
Conference call was held with MDHHS Worker on August 2, 2022. MDHHS worker
reported there is no findings to their investigation.
Documents Reviewed:
 Facility incident report dated 07/04/2022 completed by Staff 1- This report
was consistent with the interview that occurred with Staff 1 on July 6, 2022.
 Facility incident report dated 07/04/2022 completed by Staff 2- This report
was consistent with the interview that occurred with Staff 2 on July 6, 2022.
 Facility incident report dated 07/04/2022 completed by Staff 3- This report
was consistent with the interview that occurred with Staff 3 on July 6, 2022.
 Youth A’s Safety Plan updated 12/28/2021- Youth A’s safety plan notes Youth
A has a history of sexually inappropriate behavior including inappropriately
sexually touching peers, inappropriate sexual comments towards peers and staff,
viewing sexually explicit images/video on the internet and physical aggression.
The plan notes staff should keep youth A in line of sight of staff at all times when
he is in the milieu. The plan defines line of sight to mean that staff are able to see
Youth B and what he is doing and staff are making certain that he is being safe.
The plan notes staff should not assume another staff has line of sight on Youth
A. Staff will complete variable eyes-on checks of Youth A when in his bedroom
during first and second shift and will document these checks when Youth A is in
his room for more than 15 minutes. Staff will make their presence known and
6

provide direct and clear expectations to Youth A including redirecting him. It was
noted on 07/04/2022 that all staff assigned on shift reviewed the safety planned
and signed off.
 Youth B’s Acute Risk Intervention Plan dated 07/05/2022- Youth B and Youth
A are to remain on separate milieu areas. Staff are to keep Youth B in line of
vision during waking hours with the exception of when she is in her bedroom or
bathroom.
 Youth B’s Safety Plan dated 07/07/2022- Youth B’s safety plan notes Youth B
should be in line of sight of staff at all times when she is in the milieu, the
cafeteria, outside on campus, at the gym, and in the community. Staff are to have
visual monitoring of the hallway whenever Youth B is down the hallway and will
complete eyes- on checks of Youth B at variable increments no longer than 15
minutes apart when she is in her bedroom.
 Resident Supervision Guideline- This policy states staff’s main job expectation
is supervision of residents. It notes in the milieu staff will have residents in their
line of sight at all times. It also states if the youth walk down the hallway staff are
to position themselves to be able to see all youth. The policy states that staff are
expected to verbally communicate with their team members where they are and if
they need to move positions throughout the shift.
 Developmental Adolescent Residential Treatment Staff to Resident Ratio-
The policy notes at a minimum, the child to staff ratio at DART is two youth to
one staff during awake hours and four youth to one staff for normal sleeping
hours.
 Human Resource File for Staff 1 and Staff 2- There were no disciplinary or
performance evaluations that reflected poorly pertaining to Staff 1 and Staff 2’s
work with youth at the facility. Training records were viewed and noted Staff 1
and Staff 2 were up to date on training requirements.
 Human Resource File for Staff 3- There was one medication disciplinary action
noted for Staff 3 in March 2022. Staff 3 was given a verbal warning for not
following safety plan of a youth and not following the supervision expectations.
Training records were viewed and noted Staff 4 is up to date on training
requirements.
 Facility Staff Schedule for July 4, 2022- The facility staff schedule noted Staff 1
was assigned to supervise Youth A and Youth C; Staff 2 was assigned to
supervise Youth B; and Staff 3 was assigned to supervise Youth D and Youth E
on July 4, 2022.
 Facility Team Meeting Minutes dated April 2021 to July 2022- Within the
facility team meeting minutes on 04/27/21, 04/28/21, 04/29/21, 01/04/22,
01/06/22, 02/22/22, 02/24/22, 07/26/22 and 07/28/22, the notes showed
leadership reminding staff they need to review and sign each youths’ safety plan
when they are on shift. There was no nothing at what time of shift the staff need
to review the safety plan and sign.
7

APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4126 Sufficiency of staff.
The licensee shall have a sufficient number of
administrative, supervisory, social service, direct care, and
other staff on duty to perform the prescribed functions
required by these administrative rules and in the agency's
program statement and to provide for the continual needs,
protection, and supervision of residents.
ANALYSIS: The facility is found in non-compliance of sufficiency of staff.
The staff did not follow the protocol of communicating when
Youth A and Youth B were let into the living area of the unit to
use the bathroom and bedroom. This led to Youth A and Youth
B being left unsupervised on the living area side. Youth A has a
safety plan in place that notes sexual behavioral concerns and
staff should be aware of his location at all times.
Technical Assistance:
The safety plan policy for the facility should be reviewed and
updated to indicate at what time staff should review and sign off
on a youth’s safety plan during their shift.
CONCLUSION: REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
